definition: nature/character/property/quality/attribute/sexuality/sex/gender/suffix forming adjective from verb/suffix forming noun from adjective, corresponding to -ness or -ity/essence/CL:個|个[ge4]
to feel attached to/to long for/to love

(after a verb or adjective) one who (is) .../(after a noun) person involved in .../-er/-ist/(used after a number or 後|后[hou4] or 前[qian2] to refer to sth mentioned previously)/(used after a term, to mark a pause before defining the term)/(old) (used at the end of a command)/(old) this

sentences.chinese: 但是王先生也是同性戀者。

sentences.english: Do you have a lesbian in your life?
sentences.chinese: 你生命中是否有女同性戀者？

sentences.english: Wilde went on to become homosexual worship the "ancestral."
sentences.chinese: 王爾德甚至成了同性戀者頂禮膜拜的“祖師爺”。

sentences.english: Lesbianism gained its name from the Greek island of Lesbos.
sentences.chinese: 女同性戀者的名稱出自希臘的萊斯博斯島。

sentences.english: Homosexuals have also made it a practice to dump on religious leaders.
sentences.chinese: 同性戀者也以詰難宗教領袖爲慣用手法。

sentences.english: The Anti-Homosexuality Bill is yet to be formally debated by the Ugandan parliament.
sentences.chinese: 反同性戀者比爾尚未在烏干達會議上進行正式辯論。

sentences.english: Two examples of homosexuals, the names of whom I am sure you know.
sentences.chinese: 同性戀者的兩個例子，我相信你們知道他們的名字。

sentences.english: The results showed that only two men into homosexuals to insist on safe sex.
sentences.chinese: 結果顯示，僅兩成男同性戀者能堅持安全性行爲。

sentences.english: Erwin Lutzer has a brand-new book called The Truth About Same-Sex Marriage.
sentences.chinese: 歐文路次爾有一本新書，叫《同性戀者結婚的真相》。

sentences.english: You can’t repeat this, but he is gay.
sentences.chinese: 你千萬別說出去啊，他是同性戀者。

sentences.english: The discrimination inherent in that second-class status is harmful to gay men and lesbians.
sentences.chinese: 潛藏於次等地位中的歧視無疑對同性戀者極爲不利。

sentences.english: Those groups are Filipino migrant workers and homosexuals.
sentences.chinese: 那兩羣人是菲律賓籍勞工和同性戀者。

sentences.english: Wilde went on to become homosexual worship the "God of ancestors."
sentences.chinese: 王爾德甚至成了同性戀者頂禮膜拜的“祖爺”。

sentences.english: The AIDS epidemic further stigmatised gays.
sentences.chinese: 艾滋病的流行讓人們更加瞧不起男同性戀者。

sentences.english: The fact of the matter is, the majority of visitors to the island are non-gay.
sentences.chinese: 實際情況是，多數去島上的參觀者是非同性戀者。

sentences.english: Gays and lesbians are known for their non-traditional relationships.
sentences.chinese: 同性戀者們的不同之處就在於這種非傳統的關係。

definition: variant of 抵觸|抵触[di3 chu4]
to confuse one thing with another (idiom); to muddle
to avoid the important and dwell on the trivial/to keep silent about major charges while admitting minor ones
